UP to (8,5): That's moving towards the top. There's an apple at (1,5), but that's quite a distance away. Also, moving up might take me away from other apples that are closer.

I should also consider if moving LEFT would put me in a position where I might hit myself. Since my body is at (8,4) and I'm moving left, I don't have any other body parts in that direction, so that's safe.

Another thing to think about is the enemy snake. It's at (8,3), so if I move LEFT, I'm moving away from it. If I had moved DOWN, I would have died, but since I'm not doing that, I'm avoiding the enemy. So, moving LEFT seems safe.

I don't see any immediate threats in the other directions. Moving UP or RIGHT doesn't lead to an apple, so it's better to go for the one right in front of me.

So, my strategy is to prioritize eating apples when possible, especially the closest ones, to gain points and grow quickly. Avoiding enemies and walls is crucial, so I need to make sure my move doesn't put me in danger.
